text: In Plots.jl with the GR backend, is it normal that plotting big datasets takes a long time/consumes a lot of memory? I have (20, 5e5) datapoints, and am waiting minutes every time I plot. I am in VS Code with the plot pane, if that matters.

elements.text: In Plots.jl with the GR backend, is it normal that plotting big datasets takes a long time/consumes a lot of memory? I have (20, 5e5) datapoints, and am waiting minutes every time I plot. I am in VS Code with the plot pane, if that matters.

text: i think it is making SVGs, so a lot of data takes a long time. If you switch to PNG you will likely see a big speedup. `plot(rand(10), fmt = :png)`

elements.text: i think it is making SVGs, so a lot of data takes a long time. If you switch to PNG you will likely see a big speedup.

text:
Hmm, that does not seem to improve things, the opposite indeed :slightly_smiling_face:
```julia> @time plot(y)
  4.893566 seconds (16.17 M allocations: 797.192 MiB, 3.09% gc time)

julia> @time plot(y, fmt=:png)
  7.536678 seconds (16.17 M allocations: 797.345 MiB, 5.26% gc time)```

elements.text: Hmm, that does not seem to improve things, the opposite indeed

julia> @time plot(y)
  4.893566 seconds (16.17 M allocations: 797.192 MiB, 3.09% gc time)

julia> @time plot(y, fmt=:png)
  7.536678 seconds (16.17 M allocations: 797.345 MiB, 5.26% gc time)

text: These times are also clearly not the total time it takes, I have to wait for ~1 min or so before the plot actually shows.

elements.text: These times are also clearly not the total time it takes, I have to wait for ~1 min or so before the plot actually shows.

text:
```@time display(plot(y))```
to get the total time

Thanks, the bottleneck seems to just be the enormous amount of data:
```julia> @time display(plot(y))
152.126635 seconds (1.02 G allocations: 18.842 GiB, 1.02% gc time)

julia> @time display(plot(y, fmt=:png))
154.836029 seconds (1.02 G allocations: 18.842 GiB, 1.03% gc time)```

text: Is there any way around this? Because else I will just have to plot only  some intermediate points or something like this.
